title: philipma1957
author: philipma1957
content: Quote from: Emilly9322 on February 25, 2023, 06:31:10 PMhey) Emilly, 25, female. Rate my naked photos on sex dating site, click link:¬†http : ¬†// freedate24 . com / hotgirl93sent sent link above I gave a distrust.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3537576Not sure if I was only target.please note link above is disabledalso reported it to admin

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: For all we know this could be a trick used by a spouse. Otherwise why wouldn't they send me these interesting offers? Lol. Philipma the undercover vice.üòâ

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Perhaps someone trying to target you for a now famous pig butchering scam?Out of curiosity, I visited the "dating" site, and they ask for some info about you (Social engineering) and then probably link you to a profile of someone as a "beautiful woman" who will try to scam you afterward.

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on February 25, 2023, 06:44:31 PMalso reported it to adminThat's the right thing everybody should do when they see a spam PM like that. I don't think many people would fall for this type of trap in this forum though.The user is already banned.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on February 25, 2023, 09:44:54 PMPerhaps someone trying to target you for a now famous pig butchering scam?Looks like emily just really want to get rated by philipma and from others on different sites that's why she spammed the internet.I found lots of sites (at least 10) posted with the link searching in google, also the url directs to other sites looks like it is referral link or something.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: A new reason to block private messages from new accounts, I guess?¬† Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on February 25, 2023, 09:44:54 PMPerhaps someone trying to target you for a now famous pig butchering scam?Out of curiosity, I visited the "dating" site, and they ask for some info about you (Social engineering) and then probably link you to a profile of someone as a "beautiful woman" who will try to scam you afterward.It is¬† very possible, this is a forum about Bitcoin, a forum mostly about digital money.But for your theory to get some more strength¬† I would have expected to see that newbie account (and other accounts) to spam more members, specially those who participate in sections like Gambling and Trading, where one can find people who obviously have some money.Let us see if more people appear with the same or similar PM to show, otherwise this might be a very targeted scam attempt against philipma1957.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: I can say when a naked person ask to click to her link, it's obviously scam because the domain name is really suspicious.There are a lot platforms where she can use it to sell her naked pictures or videos e.g. onlyfans, pornhub, private telegram, private twitter etc. Honestly there are a lot users in twitter where they're genuine asking to rate her naked photos by directly send her photos.Quote from: Hispo on February 26, 2023, 02:21:28 AMA new reason to block private messages from new accounts, I guess?¬† In default, newbie message already get blocked, so I don't see any good reason to allow receive message from a newbie account.

comments.author: UserU
comments.body: Man, OP being lucky on being offered free noods.Meanwhile I get shitty campaign management services :/

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: Hispo on February 26, 2023, 02:21:28 AMA new reason to block private messages from new accounts, I guess? ¬†It's not new, this has always been the reason. But Newbies (unless whitelisted) can only send 2 PMs per day (to reduce spam), and I've received more legitimate PMs than spam. So I'm not blocking Newbies.This is the typical spam that I've received by email thousands of times. They won't get large numbers of messages on Bitcointalk. It doesn't look like targeted spam either, the link leads to paiatialdates.new and claims Alessandra lives 3 miles away from my Tor browser Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on February 25, 2023, 09:44:54 PMOut of curiosity, I visited the "dating" site, and they ask for some info about you (Social engineering) and then probably link you to a profile of someone as a "beautiful woman" who will try to scam you afterward.Isn't that how most dating sites work?

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: Despairo on February 26, 2023, 04:21:22 AMIn default, newbie message already get blocked, so I don't see any good reason to allow receive message from a newbie account.Newbies can have genuine query to ask someone personal and what if theymos or Global mod thought same as you and decided to disable their PMing feature? These kind of scams are new which exists all over the internet and also there were some in bitcointalk which can be seens in service section but paying money to watch them N*k*d doesn't worth cause we can see them in HD quality for free on many sites.

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on February 26, 2023, 08:01:04 AMThis is the typical spam that I've received by email thousands of times. They won't get large numbers of messages on Bitcointalk. It doesn't look like targeted spam either, the link leads to paiatialdates.new and claims Alessandra lives 3 miles away from my Tor browser She is also using Tor...¬† What I find most incredible about this type of spam is that the fact that it still exists today means that many people still fall for this scam!I can't understand, how does a person receive a message from a stranger making proposals that are also strange, and people believe it.I am always amazed when I hear these reports.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on February 26, 2023, 09:51:22 AMQuote from: LoyceV on February 26, 2023, 08:01:04 AMThis is the typical spam that I've received by email thousands of times. They won't get large numbers of messages on Bitcointalk. It doesn't look like targeted spam either, the link leads to paiatialdates.new and claims Alessandra lives 3 miles away from my Tor browser She is also using Tor...¬† What I find most incredible about this type of spam is that the fact that it still exists today means that many people still fall for this scam!I can't understand, how a person receive a message from a stranger making proposals that are also strange, and people believe it.I am always amazed when I hear these reports.Some persons visit these sex dating sites so when they see this invitation they think it is one of the websites they usually visit, so they end up being scammed. Some persons are not also well informed about this type of scam so they end up learning the hard way from experience. But I think this person is on the wrong platform, bitcointalk is not a fertile ground for his tricks.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on February 26, 2023, 09:51:22 AMWhat I find most incredible about this type of spam is that the fact that it still exists today means that many people still fall for this scam!I think it's a combination of (sexual) desperation, gullibility and naivety. Even if only 0.001% of the people who receive the (email) spam fall for it, it's still profitable for the scammers.Quote from: Fiatless on February 26, 2023, 10:14:07 AMI think this person is on the wrong platform, bitcointalk is not a fertile ground for his tricks.I guess you weren't around when alia was active

comments.author: shahzadafzal
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on February 25, 2023, 06:44:31 PMQuote from: Emilly9322 on February 25, 2023, 06:31:10 PMhey) Emilly, 25, female. Rate my naked photos on sex dating site, click link:¬†http :¬† // freedate24 . com / hotgirl93It‚Äôs a trap Emilly is not 25 but 30. ‚Äúhotgirl93‚Äù that means 1993 and that makes her 30 not 25. Once a liar always a liar.Rejected üôÖ

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: It's something similar what I often get to my email and Facebook Messenger. Scammers are using every possible platform for these kind of messages. Bitcointalk isn't exception.Quote from: shahzadafzal on February 26, 2023, 11:14:30 AMIt‚Äôs a trap Emilly is not 25 but 30. ‚Äúhotgirl93‚Äù that means 1993 and that makes her 30 not 25. Once a liar always a liar.Rejected üôÖ Good catch . But most likely it's not even girl. But most likely it's fat, mid-aged dude who lives in his mother's house and never had women in his life is behind this account.Quote from: LoyceV on February 26, 2023, 10:53:58 AMI guess you weren't around when alia was active alia, I remember this name, but I can't remember what exactly she was doing here.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: This is suspicious, and I think you have been on a target for long who knows if this user want to link you on a phishing site. Just imagine someone creating a new account yesterday same time sent out a private messages to you to rate her naked body. Why must it be you alone why not other users here, just take a good look at me I haven't received such pm before. Lols.Anyway just be careful and don't click to such link because scammers always believed not all men that hardly resist nude pictures at which whenever you clicked on the link you are automatically being piped and instantly extract your information from your browser. Its mostly common with those who do Auto save password on their browsers.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on February 26, 2023, 10:53:58 AMQuote from: joker_josue on February 26, 2023, 09:51:22 AMWhat I find most incredible about this type of spam is that the fact that it still exists today means that many people still fall for this scam!I think it's a combination of (sexual) desperation, gullibility and naivety. Even if only 0.001% of the people who receive the (email) spam fall for it, it's still profitable for the scammers.Quote from: Fiatless on February 26, 2023, 10:14:07 AMI think this person is on the wrong platform, bitcointalk is not a fertile ground for his tricks.I guess you weren't around when alia was active Desperation is the key üîë.If you are a guy and have been in a good space for years with your woman this type of pm is pretty much no threat.But if you have had a breakup and are lonely you may say maybe I could get lucky.So is this person sends out 1000 of these and gets a few replies it is worth doing.Please note since I phrased this from my viewpoint it is not a reflection on any other style of sex life that you have.But if you are in a good space you laugh at these pms.And if you sex life is not working you may try it.I posted here as I wondered how many got this one. From her or anyone else.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on February 27, 2023, 04:36:14 AMI posted here as I wondered how many got this one. From her or anyone else.I didn't get it from him or from other users. Even newbie never got permission to PM me because I prevented it with blue tick not activated, so how about you? Or maybe you will prevent it too after this?Newbie with bad intention can send PMs to anyone they target, including well-known users like you. They can even deliver much more dangerous malware for security. So consider that blue tick not enabled in your private message settings.

comments.author: imamusma
comments.body: Quote from: _BlackStar on February 27, 2023, 05:45:16 AMSo consider that blue tick not enabled in your private message settings.I think this is the default setting regarding every forum user's private message option, and in most cases it is not enabled by users because they don't want to get PM's from newbies. Every user has a reason why they don't want to enable it, and that's fine.
